page.title: 01 THE KIRKBY LONSDALE AREA
page.content: { The Kirkby Lonsdale area is mainly agricultural with little industry. Situated in the quiet valley of the river Lune, Kirkby itself, with its {population}of over 2000, is a small market town which meets the requirements of the surrounding villages.{Market day,}with stalls in the Square, is Thursday.It has a large range of shops, catering for both locals and the many{tourists.}It contains the usual services, garages, police and fire stations, as well as schools.Mainly,{farming}is of cattle and sheep, both in valley and fell. There are many traditional stone-built farm buildings and dry stone walls, and a multitude of winding country roads and lanes.
